Dialogue.content: Hi, I'm Liam Johnson. It's nice to meet you!
Hello, Liam! It's great to meet you too. What brings you in today?
I'm really excited about this semester. I'm studying Political Science and looking forward to getting involved in advocacy work.
That sounds fantastic! Advocacy work can be very rewarding. Do you have any specific goals for this semester?
Well, I want to secure an internship, but I'm feeling anxious about the competition and managing my grades. Plus, my sister Priya is struggling in high school, and I want to support her.
It's commendable that you want to help your sister while also pursuing your goals. How do you feel about balancing these responsibilities?
Hi again. I'm feeling really overwhelmed right now.
Hello, Liam! I'm glad to see you back. What's been making you feel overwhelmed?
It's just a lot. Between classes, trying to help Priya, and my responsibilities in student government, I feel exhausted.
That does sound like a heavy load to carry. Have you had any time to take care of yourself amidst all these commitments?
Not really. I haven't been able to play soccer or hang out with friends much, and I miss that.
Self-care is really important, especially when you're balancing so much. What if you set aside just a small amount of time each week to engage in those activities?
Hey, I just came back from a group meeting and I felt really inadequate.
Hi, Liam. I'm sorry to hear that. What made you feel inadequate during the meeting?
I struggled to contribute meaningfully, and my peers ended up picking up the slack. I just felt so lost.
It's understandable to feel that way, especially under pressure. Did you talk with anyone in your group about how you were feeling?
I talked to Josh, but I'm still feeling disheartened. I keep doubting my abilities both academically and as a brother.
That's a tough position to be in. You're trying to support yourself and your sister, and it's okay to feel overwhelmed. What would you consider as a practical step to regain your confidence?
Hi! I went to see a counselor on campus, and it felt good to talk about everything I've been experiencing.
That's great to hear, Liam! How did it feel to express your feelings?
It was relieving. They suggested I try setting some boundaries and prioritize self-care, but I'm unsure if I can really do that.
It's completely normal to feel unsure about making changes. What's one specific boundary you could start with this week?
Maybe I could reserve some time for soccer practice a couple of days a week—that would help me mentally.
That sounds like a positive step! Remember, taking care of yourself will ultimately help you support others better. Keep me posted on how it goes!
Thank you for your support! I really appreciate it.
